Package com.sr2.flopbox.controller

Class ServerResource

java.lang.Object
com.sr2.flopbox.controller.ServerResource
@Path("servers")
public class ServerResource
extends Object
Server resource (exposed at "server" path) which allow to get all (GET), get (GET), create (POST), update( PUT) and delete (DELETE) a server
Author:
Adrien Holvoet

      public ServerResource()

  • Method Details

    • getServers

      @GET @Produces("application/json") public jakarta.ws.rs.core.Response getServers()
      Method handling HTTP GET requests. The returned object will be sent to the client as "application/json" media type.
      Returns:
      Response will be all existing servers or an error code with a message corresponding to the exception caught.

    • getServer

      @GET @Path("{alias}") @Produces("application/json") public jakarta.ws.rs.core.Response getServer​(@PathParam("alias") String alias)
      Method handling HTTP GET requests. The returned object will be sent to the client as "application/json" media type.
      Parameters:
      alias - used to get the server corresponding
      Returns:
      Response will be the server corresponding to the alias specified in the path or an error code with a message corresponding to the exception caught.

    • newServer

      @POST @Consumes("application/json") @Produces("application/json") public jakarta.ws.rs.core.Response newServer​(Server server)
      Method handling HTTP POST requests. The returned object will be sent to the client as "application/json" media type.
      Parameters:
      server - server to create
      Returns:
      Response will be the server just created in or an error code with a message corresponding to the exception caught.

    • updateServer

      @PUT @Path("{alias}") @Consumes("application/json") @Produces("application/json") public jakarta.ws.rs.core.Response updateServer​(@PathParam("alias") String alias, Server server)
      Method handling HTTP PUT requests. The returned object will be sent to the client as "application/json" media type.
      Parameters:
      server - server to update
      alias - alias of the server to update
      Returns:
      Response will be the server updated or an error code with a message corresponding to the exception caught.

    • deleteServer

      @DELETE @Path("{alias}") public jakarta.ws.rs.core.Response deleteServer​(@PathParam("alias") String alias)
      Method handling HTTP DELETE requests. The returned object will be sent to the client as "application/json" media type.
      Parameters:
      alias - server to delete
      Returns:
      Response will be 204 no content if succeed or an error code with a message corresponding to the exception caught.
